definition: To extend or protrude vertically from a surface, often used to describe an object or structure that stands out prominently. It is commonly used to refer to something that juts out or projects above its surroundings.

examples.german: Der Turm ragt hoch in den Himmel.
examples.english: The tower rises high into the sky.

examples.german: Die Berge ragen majestätisch über das Tal.
examples.english: The mountains loom majestically over the valley.

examples.german: Der Felsen ragt steil aus dem Meer.
examples.english: The rock juts steeply out of the sea.

examples.german: Die Spitze des Berges ragt über die Wolken.
examples.english: The peak of the mountain protrudes above the clouds.

examples.german: Der Baum ragt hoch über die anderen Bäume.
examples.english: The tree towers above the other trees.
